ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my writing and close-reading abilities through this course.
Close reading skills, essay writing and structure skills, reading comprehension and analysis, productive class discussion.
Truly a great English class. I loved it.
I learned so much more about Yale and college campus fictions.
I learned a lot about the genre of campus fictions and about Yale itself. I improved my literary analysis and close reading writing skills as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: great professor, super engaging content, clear expectations, great instruction

I think the variety of texts we studied helped contribute to a deeper understanding to the topic of campus fiction, and I enjoyed looking through fiction and creative nonfiction sources. I also enjoyed learning how to effectively write three different types of essays as I look forward to my academic career. Discussion was often productive, and classes spent peer editing or learning writing strategies were helpful.
Such a great course, everything was so good!
I loved the course as it was.

The strengths of this course were the professor, the students, the novels we read, the movies we watched, and class discussions. The course has no clear weaknesses except that we only read 1 book in full. I think it would have been nice to read a few more, but I am grateful for the amount of content we covered by doing excerpts.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely. I thoroughly enjoyed this course. My writing skills improved and we read materials that I would have read for pure enjoyment outside of class. Professor Card is fantastic at designing classes that allow students to discuss readings and engage in meaningful conversation. I learned a lot from my peers about how to interpret passages through these seminar classes and really enjoyed the discussions that were held in this class. Learning about Yale through a literary lens was super cool and gave me a greater appreciation for the place I get to study, but also a greater awareness of its flaws and what the institution needs to change.

Absolutely  it is both incredibly interesting and helpful toward developing reading and writing skills. Texts and topics studied are useful in both the world of literature and as a tool for reflection as college students.
Absolutely! Great material with a great Professor.
YES! Prof. Card is amazing and the content of the course is so interesting.

Yes! I adore this course and Professor Card. This is a great college English class for students of all grades. The reading list was fun and class discussions were great as the topics were relative to most if not all of the students.
